subject: black box or white box?
msgSnippet: J.B. Rainsberger wrote:  ... black-box ...  okay, i m confused about black box and white box testing. i ve heard a couple of people say that
messageBody:
J.B. Rainsberger wrote:
<snip>
> JUnit is not a codepath analysis tool; it is a tool for expressing
black-box
> tests at the class level.
</snip>

okay, i'm confused about "black box" and "white box" testing.

i've heard a couple of people say that JUnit is a tool for "black box"
testing (at the class/method/"unit") level. i even think Kent Beck said
something to that effect in the TDD book.

but I think i've heard other people refer to "unit testing" and "white box
testing" as though they were synonyms.

I'm particularly confused about the following example:

Let's say that I'm testing some code that exercises a database. So i create
a MockStatement and say "ms.setExpectedUpdateCalls(3)", or something to that
effect, and pass it in to my object.

In my view, this is tantamount to designing a "probe" which will fit through
one of the holes in the box (ie conforms to the public interface), thereby
allowing us to snoop on what is happening inside the box.... Now, maybe i'm
just misunderstanding the terminology, but my gut tells me that this should
not count as "black box" testing.

And if this is "black box" testing, what the heck counts as "white box"
testing?


-Brian
